category.title: Category
category.description: Helps in narrowing down a sport to a specific country or discipline.

category.title: Category
category.description: Helps in narrowing down a sport to a specific country or discipline.

crowdsourcingEnabled.title: Tells if users can post suggests on UT.

hasPerformanceGraphFeature.title: Tells if UT has performance graph.

roundPrefix.title: Prefix for round names of all events in the tournament.
roundPrefix.description: E.g. "UCL Preliminary Round" Tournament has round prefix "Preliminary".

isLive.title: Currently used only for MMA tournaments because they have several events (fights) in succession.
isLive.description:
When the first fight in the tournament starts the flag is set to true.
When the last fight in the tournament ends the flag is set back to false.

winnerCode.title:
0 - Undefined
1 - Home Team
2 - Away Team
3 - Draw.

current.title: Current score contains final score of the match, including penalties.

display.title: Score displayed to the end user.
display.description: During penalty shootout display score includes normaltime [+ overtime] + penalties, but when it ends it contains score without penalties.

period1.title: Scores for every period of the match.
period1.description:
Football:
 - period1: 1st half
 - period2: 2nd half
 - overtime: 1st extra + 2nd extra

Basketball:
 - period1..4: quarters

Tennis:
 - period1..5: sets, e.g. 6:2

period1TieBreak.title: Tennis tie-break score for every set in the match.

point.title: Points in a game (tennis, volleyball, table-tennis, ...).

normaltime.title: Sum of scores from regular periods (non-overtime).

overtime.title: Overtime score.
overtime.description:
May be used for sports with more than two extra periods
or in case we only need accumulated extra time scores.

aggregated.title: Aggregated score is the combined number of goals team has scored over two or more games.

series.title: Series score is the number of games team won in a series.
series.description: E.g. In NBA playoff finals 21/22 Celtics - Warriors 4 - 2

current.title: Current score contains final score of the match, including penalties.

display.title: Score displayed to the end user.
display.description: During penalty shootout display score includes normaltime [+ overtime] + penalties, but when it ends it contains score without penalties.

period1.title: Scores for every period of the match.
period1.description:
Football:
 - period1: 1st half
 - period2: 2nd half
 - overtime: 1st extra + 2nd extra

Basketball:
 - period1..4: quarters

Tennis:
 - period1..5: sets, e.g. 6:2

period1TieBreak.title: Tennis tie-break score for every set in the match.

point.title: Points in a game (tennis, volleyball, table-tennis, ...).

normaltime.title: Sum of scores from regular periods (non-overtime).

overtime.title: Overtime score.
overtime.description:
May be used for sports with more than two extra periods
or in case we only need accumulated extra time scores.

aggregated.title: Aggregated score is the combined number of goals team has scored over two or more games.

series.title: Series score is the number of games team won in a series.
series.description: E.g. In NBA playoff finals 21/22 Celtics - Warriors 4 - 2

period1.title: Duration of each period of the match.

played.title: Total game time for sports with clock stopping.

injuryTime1.title: Injury time duration for every period.

initial.title: Starting time for the current period.
initial.description: Exp.: in football for the second half this value will be 45min.

max.title: Maximum time value for the current period.
max.description: Exp.: in football for the second half this value will be 90min.

extra.title:
Maximum time value for the current period beyond the 'max'
Exp.: in football this is injury (additional referee added) time.

detailId.title: 0 - A decision on how this game will be covered has not yet been made.
detailId.description:
1 - This game will be covered to the maximum level of detail; all ball events with time stamps and x/y coordinates.
2 - All ball events are collected by without positional information.
3 - Provides just data on shots, goals with assists, throwins, freekicks, corners, offsides, cards & substitutions.
4 - This game will only have data on start/end of match, team lineups, cards, goals and scores.
5 - This will only have start and end times, goals and the scorers.
6 - This game will only have scores information available; the goal scorers will not be included.

crowdsourcingDataDisplayEnabled.title: Tells if crowdsourcing data will be displayed on platforms

startTimestamp.title: Start timestamp.
startTimestamp.description: Unix timestamp representing the start time of the event.
